ReferenceSummary: Apple and Microsoft compete across a huge range of software, hardware, and other tech sub-industries​investopedia.com.
Apple and Google dominate mobile operating systems and app ecosystems (iOS vs Android)​reuters.com.
Google pays Apple an estimated $20 billion+ per year to be the default search engine on Apple devices​reuters.com.
Apple partnered with Goldman Sachs to launch the Apple Card credit card, with Goldman as the issuing bank​goldmansachs.com.
Apple Card also runs on Mastercard’s payments network under Apple’s partnership with Mastercard​apple.com.
Amazon Web Services and Microsoft Azure compete as leading cloud computing platforms​reuters.com.
Amazon’s AWS and Google Cloud vie for enterprise cloud market share (alongside Azure)​reuters.com.
Oracle competes with cloud heavyweights like Microsoft and Amazon, which have a much larger presence in cloud services​reuters.com.
Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) and Intel are fierce rivals in PC and server processors​reuters.com.
AMD faces intense competition from Nvidia (the GPU and AI chip leader) in graphics and AI processors​reuters.com.
Google and Meta (Facebook) form a digital advertising duopoly, together long dominating online ad spending​reuters.com.
Microsoft and Meta have partnered to integrate Microsoft’s Teams, Office, Windows and other services into Meta’s VR platforms​blogs.microsoft.com.
Netflix and Disney+ compete head-to-head in the streaming video market, each vying for subscribers​reuters.com.
Netflix and Amazon Prime Video both compete in streaming content (and have even expanded into live sports streaming)​reuters.com.
AT&T and Verizon are the two largest U.S. wireless carriers and longstanding direct rivals in telecommunications​reuters.com.
UnitedHealth Group and CVS Health (which owns Aetna) are among the biggest health insurers, competing closely in insurance and health services​ama-assn.org.
CVS Health and Walgreens Boots Alliance are the two largest U.S. pharmacy chains, competing nationally in retail pharmacy and healthcare services​reuters.com.
Walmart (the world’s largest retailer) has invested in e-commerce and advertising to challenge Amazon’s retail and media dominance​reuters.com.
Walmart and Target are the two biggest U.S. general merchandise retailers, often competing for overlapping customer bases​reuters.com.
Costco and Walmart (via Sam’s Club) both vie for consumer retail spend, though Costco’s membership model targets more affluent shoppers​reuters.com.
Home Depot and Lowe’s are direct competitors as the top two U.S. home improvement retail chains​reuters.com.
Tesla is the U.S. EV market leader while legacy automaker GM is investing heavily to catch up in electric vehicle sales​reuters.com.
Tesla’s dominance in EVs has Ford racing to expand its own electric lineup; Ford has been a top contender for #2 U.S. EV maker behind Tesla​reuters.com.
Coca-Cola and PepsiCo have waged a decades-long “cola war,” competing fiercely for global soft drink market share​reuters.com.
FedEx and UPS are bitter rivals in the parcel delivery industry, often battling for market share and major logistics contracts​reuters.com.
FedEx long handled deliveries for Amazon, but by 2019 FedEx ended its ground and air contracts as Amazon built its own courier network – turning a former client into a competitor​reuters.com.
Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley are archrivals on Wall Street, competing for dominance in investment banking and trading​reuters.com.
Visa (the largest payment network) and its closest rival Mastercard operate a global duopoly in card payment processing​reuters.com.
Boeing and Lockheed Martin often compete for big U.S. defense projects; e.g., Boeing just beat Lockheed for the Air Force’s Next Generation fighter jet contract​reuters.com.
Boeing and Lockheed Martin jointly own United Launch Alliance (ULA), a 50–50 rocket-launch venture serving U.S. government space missions​reuters.com.
Exxon Mobil and Chevron are the two largest U.S. oil companies and longtime rivals in the petroleum industry​reuters.com.
Exxon and Chevron’s CEOs held preliminary merger talks in early 2020 about combining the companies (an idea that did not ultimately proceed)​reuters.com.
NextEra Energy made an unsolicited takeover approach to Duke Energy in 2020, which Duke rebuffed, though NextEra remained interested​reuters.com.
Intel and AMD have been direct competitors in the microprocessor industry for over 50 years​investopedia.com​investopedia.com.
AMD is regarded as the closest rival to Nvidia in the market for high-end data center and AI chips​reuters.com.
Coca-Cola and PepsiCo have engaged in a legendary rivalry (“Cola Wars”) for over a century as the two global leaders in the beverage industry​marketingdive.com.
Mastercard and Visa dominate the payments market, with Visa’s U.S. debit network about three times larger than its nearest competitor, Mastercard​paymentsdive.com.
Bank of America’s main competitors include JPMorgan Chase – BoA is the second-largest U.S. bank while JPMorgan is the largest​investopedia.com.
Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley have been top rivals on Wall Street for nearly a century, continuing a high-stakes investment banking rivalry​investopedia.com.
CVS Health and Walgreens Boots Alliance are the two largest U.S. pharmacy chains, often swapping the #1 spot in retail pharmacy market share​medcitynews.com.
Target faces a significant competitor in Walmart – one of the world’s largest retailers offering similar products and services to attract customers​businessmodelanalyst.com.
Disney and Netflix are direct rivals in the streaming media market, with both vying for subscribers and content dominance​reuters.com.
Amazon and Walmart have an intensifying rivalry as the two largest U.S. retailers; Walmart has been striving to catch up to Amazon in e-commerce​digitalcommerce360.com.
Apple and Microsoft have a decades-long rivalry marked by periods of industry dominance, comebacks, and iconic leadership​washingtonpost.com.
AT&T and Verizon have a fierce, long-running rivalry, often trading blows for the top spot in the US telecom market​thebrandhopper.com.
Home Depot and Lowe’s form a U.S. home-improvement retail duopoly, with Lowe’s now the second-largest after losing the #1 position to Home Depot​fifthperson.com.
AMD supplies custom processors (combined CPU/GPU chips) for Microsoft’s Xbox consoles​pcgamer.com​pcgamer.com.
Tesla has equipped newer Model 3 and Model Y electric cars with AMD’s Ryzen processors for infotainment, replacing its previous Intel chips​notebookcheck.net​notebookcheck.net.
Oracle and Nvidia expanded their partnership, with Oracle adding tens of thousands of Nvidia GPUs to power AI workloads on Oracle Cloud​reuters.com.
Apple used Intel chips in Mac computers for 15 years before ending the partnership in 2020 and transitioning to its own Apple Silicon​russell.co.uk.
Netflix runs nearly all of its computing and storage on Amazon Web Services – using over 100,000 AWS server instances to stream content globally​aws.amazon.com.
Walmart signed a 5-year strategic cloud partnership with Microsoft in 2018 to use Azure cloud and AI solutions, aimed partly at countering Amazon​theverge.com.
FedEx and Walgreens entered a long-term alliance to offer FedEx package drop-off and pickup services at ~7,500 Walgreens stores nationwide​walgreensbootsalliance.com.
UPS (via its Flight Forward unit) partnered with CVS Health to develop and launch drone deliveries of prescription drugs to customer homes​supplychaindive.com​supplychaindive.com.
Walgreens and UnitedHealth Group’s UnitedHealthcare unit agreed on a multi-year partnership to open 14 UnitedHealthcare Medicare service centers inside Walgreens stores​drugtopics.com.
CVS Health and Microsoft formed a strategic alliance in 2021 to use Azure cloud and AI tech as a foundation for CVS’s “digital-first” personalized care strategy​fiercehealthcare.com.

Walgreens Boots Alliance and Microsoft announced a seven-year strategic partnership in 2019 to develop new healthcare delivery models and technology solutions in Walgreens stores​walgreensbootsalliance.com.
Amazon partnered with Goldman Sachs to offer up to $1 million credit lines to small businesses selling on Amazon’s platform through Goldman’s Marcus lending arm​pymnts.com.
CVS Health acquired Target’s pharmacy and clinic businesses in 2015 for ~$1.9 billion, adding over 1,660 Target in-store pharmacies now operated under the CVS brand​iflr1000.com​iflr1000.com.
The CEOs of ExxonMobil and Chevron held preliminary merger discussions in early 2020 amid the pandemic-driven oil slump, though those talks were not ongoing by 2021​theguardian.com​theguardian.com.
NextEra Energy made a takeover approach to Duke Energy in 2020 (which Duke rebuffed); NextEra signaled interest in pursuing a potential merger in the future​reuters.com​reuters.com.
AT&T agreed to sell its digital ad tech unit Xandr to Microsoft in 2021, an expected divestiture as AT&T refocused away from online advertising​latimes.com.
Apple and Microsoft have been competitors in personal computing and operating systems for decades​reuters.com.
Apple’s iOS and Google’s Android dominate the mobile OS market, creating a duopoly in smartphones​reuters.com.
Apple launched Apple TV+ in 2019 to compete with streaming rivals like Netflix​reuters.com.
Apple’s streaming service entered the market to compete with Disney’s Disney+ (and Netflix)​reuters.com.
Apple TV+ and Amazon’s Prime Video are both major streaming platforms, with Apple aiming to challenge Amazon’s digital media presence​reuters.com.
Microsoft and Google are tech giants in direct rivalry across cloud, AI, and productivity software​reuters.com.
Microsoft’s Azure and Amazon’s AWS vie for cloud market leadership, dominating ~75% of the UK cloud market combined​reuters.com.
Microsoft (Azure, SQL Server) and Oracle (Oracle Cloud, Database) compete in enterprise software and cloud services​forbes.com.
Oracle has a “lean and hungry arch-competitor” in Amazon’s AWS, especially in cloud infrastructure​forbes.com.
Nvidia and AMD are traditional rivals dominating the discrete GPU market​reuters.com.
AMD and Intel have been fierce competitors in the microprocessor industry for over 50 years​investopedia.com.
Google and Meta (Facebook) effectively form a digital advertising duopoly, jointly taking about 60% of US online ad revenue​reuters.com​reuters.com.
Google and Amazon are increasingly competing as Amazon’s growing advertising business challenges the Google-Facebook ad duopoly​reuters.com.
Meta’s advertising business has been hurt by Apple’s privacy changes, underscoring the competitive tensions between the two in digital ads​axios.com.
Microsoft and Meta announced a surprise partnership in 2022 to bring Teams, Office and other services to Meta’s VR headsets, combining strengths in the metaverse space​theverge.com.
Netflix and Disney are direct competitors in streaming, with Disney ending its Netflix deal to launch Disney+​cnn.com.
Netflix and Amazon Prime Video compete for streaming subscribers as two of the top video platforms.
AT&T and Verizon are fierce rivals in the saturated U.S. wireless market​reuters.com.
JPMorgan Chase and Bank of America are both “Big Four” US banks and primary competitors in banking​investopedia.com.
JPMorgan and Goldman Sachs compete for Wall Street deals and clients, as two leading investment banks​marketing91.com.
Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley have a long-standing rivalry as top investment banks with differing business models​investopedia.com.
Wells Fargo competes with JPMorgan Chase (and other majors) across consumer and commercial banking services​investopedia.com.
Visa and MasterCard form a near-duopoly in payments, a dominance often scrutinized by regulators​reuters.com.
Johnson & Johnson and Pfizer are both pharma giants and key competitors in the industry (Pfizer’s largest competitor is J&J)​investopedia.com.
Pfizer and Merck & Co. are major pharmaceutical rivals across multiple therapeutic areas​investopedia.com.
UnitedHealth Group and CVS Health (via its Aetna unit) are Goliath vs Goliath in healthcare, each expanding into the other’s territory​startribune.com​startribune.com.
CVS and Walgreens Boots Alliance are archrivals, often literally operating stores next door to each other as they vie for U.S. pharmacy market share​npr.org.
Amazon and Walmart are battling for retail leadership, with Walmart “aiming to take on Amazon” in e-commerce and advertising​reuters.com.
Walmart and Target are both major U.S. retailers, and Walmart is a significant competitor to Target, offering similar products and services​businessmodelanalyst.com.
Walmart (via its Sam’s Club division) is one of Costco’s leading competitors in the membership warehouse club segment​businessmodelanalyst.com.
Home Depot and Lowe’s effectively form a home improvement duopoly, “competing for the same customers” in that market​investopedia.com.
Tesla remains the largest EV player (~44% US share) while General Motors, at ~12%, is the second-largest – highlighting their EV market competition​finance.yahoo.com.
Tesla’s dominance in electric vehicles is challenged by Ford, which is fighting for second place in US EV sales alongside GM and others​caredge.com.
Coca-Cola and PepsiCo are arch-rivals in the global soda market, with Coke recently gaining market share over its “arch rival” Pepsi​reuters.com.
FedEx and UPS are direct competitors in parcel delivery, with FedEx even losing a major USPS contract to “archrival UPS”​cbinsights.com.
Boeing and Lockheed Martin often compete for defense contracts – e.g., Boeing just beat out Lockheed to win the Air Force’s next-gen fighter deal​reuters.com.
ExxonMobil and Chevron have a long-standing rivalry as the two largest U.S. oil producers​energynow.com.
Procter & Gamble is a major supplier to Walmart – sales to Walmart account for about 15% of P&G’s total revenue​opportimes.com.
AMD supplies custom chips to Microsoft for products like the Xbox gaming console​forbes.com.
Amazon’s AWS uses AMD’s EPYC processors for certain cloud computing instances, reflecting a supplier–buyer relationship​forbes.com.
Intel was a key chip supplier to Apple for years – Apple’s Mac computers used Intel processors until Apple’s recent shift to in-house chips​cnbc.com.
Microsoft buys NVIDIA’s GPUs to power Azure’s AI and graphics workloads – a key supplier relationship in cloud computing​reuters.com.
Amazon Web Services offers cloud instances with NVIDIA GPUs, making NVIDIA a hardware supplier for Amazon’s cloud services​reuters.com.
Meta (Facebook) purchases NVIDIA’s GPU chips for AI training and data center tasks​reuters.com.
In 2019, Apple acquired Intel’s smartphone modem business for $1 billion, bringing thousands of Intel employees to Apple​cnbc.com.
In 2020, Walmart teamed up with Microsoft in a joint bid to acquire TikTok’s US operations​npr.org.
AT&T agreed to run its 5G mobile network on Microsoft’s Azure cloud – a strategic alliance to move AT&T’s 5G core to Azure​about.att.com.
Verizon and AWS have partnered to embed AWS Wavelength cloud servers at Verizon’s 5G network edge, enabling ultra-low-latency mobile applications​datacenterdynamics.com.
Morgan Stanley entered a strategic cloud partnership with Microsoft Azure to accelerate the bank’s digital transformation​news.microsoft.com.
Goldman Sachs partnered with Amazon Web Services to launch a cloud-based financial data analytics platform for institutional clients​fintechfutures.com.
American Tower leases its cellular tower infrastructure to AT&T, making AT&T a major buyer (tenant) of American Tower’s services​s1.q4cdn.com.
Verizon is a key tenant of American Tower, which provides the cell tower space Verizon needs for its wireless network​s1.q4cdn.com.
Prologis, a warehouse REIT, counts Amazon as its largest tenant, leasing distribution center space to support Amazon’s e-commerce operations​opportimes.com.
FedEx leases significant logistics and warehouse facilities from Prologis, which provides the industrial real estate for FedEx’s distribution hubs (as noted in industry reports)​opportimes.com.
Caterpillar and Freeport-McMoRan formed a partnership to retrofit 33 haul trucks at Freeport’s Bagdad copper mine with autonomous driving technology​investors.caterpillar.com.
Newmont and Caterpillar announced a strategic alliance to develop and deploy zero-emission, automated mining equipment to Newmont’s operations​newmont.com.
FedEx ended its U.S. Express and Ground delivery contracts with Amazon in 2019, formally ending their shipping partnership as Amazon built its own logistics network​supplychaindive.com.
Disney stopped licensing most of its films and content to Netflix starting in 2019 as it prepared to launch its own streaming service (Disney+)​cnn.com.

In 2020, NextEra Energy made a takeover approach to Duke Energy (then ~$60B market cap), which Duke rebuffed; though talks were preliminary, NextEra showed interest in a potential merger​reuters.com​reuters.com.

The CEOs of ExxonMobil and Chevron held preliminary merger talks in early 2020 to explore combining the two oil giants – an unprecedented “mega merger” that ultimately did not move forward​theguardian.com​theguardian.com.
Coca-Cola and PepsiCo are direct rivals in the soft drink market – both have spent decades and vast sums competing for global soda sales​reuters.com.
CVS Health and Walgreens Boots Alliance are fierce pharmacy competitors. For example, the DOJ filed similar opioid lawsuits against “Walgreens rival CVS” over unlawful prescriptions​reuters.com.
Home Depot and Lowe’s are the top U.S. home improvement retailers. Lowe’s even “echoed rival Home Depot” in forecasting similar sales trends​reuters.com.

Walmart and Amazon.com are bitter retail rivals. Walmart’s success in low-cost groceries has given it an edge over “rivals such as Target…,” while Amazon’s strong e-commerce results often signal trends for competitors Walmart and Target​reuters.com​reuters.com.

Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley have a long-standing Wall Street rivalry. Morgan Stanley’s CEO even referred to Goldman as “Morgan Stanley’s traditional rival”​reuters.com in banking performance discussions.

Bank of America and JPMorgan Chase compete as two of the largest U.S. banks. BofA is expanding branches “bringing its footprint closer to rival JPMorgan Chase”, the nation’s biggest lender​reuters.com.
AMD and Intel are fierce chip competitors in PCs and servers. Intel has long dominated, but AMD – its “biggest rival in the server and PC market” – has steadily gained share​reuters.com.

General Motors and Ford have been Detroit “crosstown” rivals for decades. In 2024, GM’s CEO prepped for earnings as “crosstown rival Ford” did the same, highlighting their ongoing competition​reuters.com.

Netflix and Disney now compete head-to-head in streaming. Disney’s Disney+ service put it in direct competition with Netflix, ending a prior content deal. Disney’s CEO even quit Apple’s board as Disney+ launched, underscoring the new rivalry​reuters.com.

Google (Alphabet) and Meta (Facebook) dominate digital advertising as a duopoly. In 2017 they collectively took ~60% of U.S. online ad revenue​reuters.com, far outpacing smaller rivals and effectively competing as the “Big Two” for ad dollars.
Warehouse REIT Prologis counts Amazon as one of its largest tenants. Prologis “counts Amazon…as its biggest customers,” leasing massive fulfillment center space to the e-commerce giant​reuters.com.
Prologis also names FedEx among its top warehouse clients. In fact, FedEx, UPS, Amazon and Home Depot are “its biggest customers,” renting extensive logistics facilities from Prologis​reuters.com.

Boeing is a key supplier of cargo aircraft to FedEx. FedEx operates large fleets of Boeing 757, 767, and 777 freighters – the two companies have “a long-standing partnership,” with FedEx the largest operator of certain Boeing freighter models​aerospaceglobalnews.com.

PepsiCo was the first customer for Tesla’s electric Semi trucks. Elon Musk confirmed PepsiCo “will get the first deliveries” of Tesla Semis, having reserved 100 units to cut fuel costs and emissions​reuters.com.

AMD supplies the custom CPUs/GPUs for Microsoft’s Xbox consoles. For example, AMD chips power Microsoft’s Xbox One S and newer Series consoles, reflecting a tight semi-custom supply relationship​reuters.com. (Xbox One S launched with AMD processors.)

Apple and Google have a lucrative deal making Google the default search on Apple devices. Google reportedly pays Apple about $20 billion per year for this privilege​reuters.com – a pact underpinning both firms’ profits (and now under antitrust scrutiny).

Apple partnered with Goldman Sachs to launch the Apple Card in 2019. This collaboration – with Goldman as issuing bank and Mastercard as network – marked a new consumer finance venture for both, and was slated to run through 2029​reuters.com. (Goldman’s CEO later indicated the partnership may end early.)

Netflix chose Microsoft as its global advertising technology partner for Netflix’s new ad-supported plan. In 2022 Netflix “selected Microsoft as technology and sales partner” for the forthcoming cheaper tier​reuters.com, leveraging Microsoft’s ad platform to launch the service.

Oracle and Microsoft formed a cloud interoperability alliance. Since 2019, the two have a multi-cloud partnership (Oracle Cloud–Azure Interconnect) enabling customers to run enterprise workloads across both clouds, reflecting an unusual collaboration between erstwhile enterprise software rivals​reuters.com.

Boeing and Lockheed Martin are 50–50 partners in United Launch Alliance (ULA), a joint venture providing U.S. rocket launch services. Formed in 2006, ULA combines Boeing’s and Lockheed’s launch divisions into one entity – with profits and control split evenly​ulalaunch.com.

JPMorgan Chase and Amazon have a long-running co-branded credit card alliance. Chase has issued Amazon’s Prime Rewards Visa for over 20 years – a “two decades-long commitment” that was recently extended, highlighting a deep integration of rewards and payments capabilities​media.chase.com​media.chase.com.

UnitedHealth Group (via OptumRx) and Walgreens have collaborated to integrate pharmacy and health services. For example, in 2016 “OptumRx and Walgreens are partnering to create a new pharmacy solution” combining Optum’s pharmacy benefits with Walgreens’ retail pharmacies​unitedhealthgroup.com.

The Walt Disney Company had a long-running licensing deal with Netflix that benefited both – Disney earned an estimated $300 million annually by giving Netflix streaming rights to certain films. That relationship lasted nearly a decade before ending when Disney launched its own Disney+ service​reuters.com.

Apple relied on Intel as its exclusive Mac chip supplier from 2005 until 2020. Apple “has used Intel chips in its computers since 2005”​reuters.com, but has now phased out Intel in favor of Apple’s own silicon – marking the end of a 15-year supplier relationship.

FedEx and Amazon used to partner on shipping, but FedEx ended its Amazon delivery contracts in 2019 as Amazon built its in-house logistics. FedEx explicitly chose not to renew its Express and Ground deals – a dramatic “break up” enabling FedEx to pursue other e-commerce clients​supplychaindive.com.

Oracle and Walmart jointly attempted to acquire a stake in TikTok’s U.S. operations in 2020 under U.S. government pressure. Oracle agreed to take 20% and Walmart was negotiating a stake (with a board seat) in a new TikTok Global – a deal blessed “in concept” by the White House​theguardian.com, though it ultimately stalled.

In early 2020, the CEOs of ExxonMobil and Chevron held preliminary merger talks to explore combining the two largest U.S. oil companies​theguardian.com. The discussions advanced far enough to draft some legal documents​theguardian.com, though they were put on hold and not ongoing as of 2021.
